column4: My openoffice doesn't work. It just displays and loads the splash and then disappears. I'm using feisty; it did work in Edgy.
The program 'oowriter' is currently not installed.  You can install it by typing:
sudo apt-get install openoffice.org-writer
bash: oowriter: command not found
But openoffice.org-writer is installed, tom_
jibsa1242: No....I guess I'll try it...
can you try that with a different user? or do a reinstall of oo
I guess I could create a new user...
But I'll try a reinstall first.
why??? for oo
can you open a new shell and try there
Define new shell. Something besides bash?
Or try it under sudo?
Or what?
bash just another instance
openoffice.org-writer still gives me nothing.
no no that should be oowriter
Still nothing
open up synaptics and reinstall openoffice package (the whole thing)
Yeah, I'm about to do that.
ajehuk: Funny, says it can't be authenticated.
